page.title: 02 THE ORCHARD THEATRE
page.content: The Orchard theatre was built in September 1982, it was opened by the Duke of Kent who likes to visit the theatre on special events. Other membersf the Royal Family have also visited the Orchard. The theare was designed to have 1,200 seats but was cut down to 912. There is an orchestra pit which can be stage level or drop down 15 feet, the dressing rooms are all the same size but the star of any show always has dressing room number one. The fire and burglar alarms are situated at the stage door, and the lighting control box is where the film projectors are kept. There are two bars a snack bar and a confectionery kiosk for refreshment. The theatre is named Orchard as it was built on the site of an orchard.
